message.txt:
Thank you for submitting your draft to AcaWriter. Quality writing comes from revision. Research shows that writing drafts and revising your text helps improve the quality of your writing.
Remember AcaWriter is a machine – so it may not highlight all your moves correctly and could give you incorrect feedback. So, don’t be afraid to disagree with the feedback, if you believe you have included all the moves in your introduction.

message.exists:
Well done, it looks like you have Background / Context moves in your introduction.
You have provided background information on your research topic and/or explained why your research topic is important which will help readers understand why your research is significant.

Well done, it looks like you have Purpose of the Paper / Present Research moves in your introduction.
You have stated the purpose of your research, and/or presented what your research is about which will make it easier for your reader to understand the goal of your research.

Well done, it looks like you have Research Problem / Issues / Critiques / Gap in the literature moves.
You have highlighted the research problem, identified issues or indicated a gap in the literature. By including this move your readers will know what problem you’re trying to solve.

message.tag_m:
AcaWriter didn't identify any Background / Context moves in your introduction.
Here you explain why your research is important, or provide background information on your research. To achieve this move try including these sentences: x is an important feature in y., Substantial evidence in x suggests that..., The study of x is important because x impacts y., x has been previously proposed..., Recent, literature concerning x has reported that..., Recent studies indicate that..., It is widely agreed that...
Check if you have included these sentences in your introduction.

AcaWriter didn't identify any Purpose of the Paper / Present Research moves in your introduction. Here you explain the purpose of your research, and/or explain what your research is about.
To achieve this move try including these sentences: The purpose of this paper is to..., In this study I focus on..., The aim of this research is to...., I explore x, I analyse x...
Check if you have included these sentences in your introduction.

AcaWriter didn't identify any Research Problem / Issues / Critiques / Gap in the literature moves in your essay.
Here you state your research problem, indicate a gap in knowledge, or identify issues in the literature. You may also use these moves to critique theories or examples. To achieve this move try including sentences like these: The problem of x has not been widely studied., This approach fails to address the issue of x., However, limited research has been conducted in x., Despite earlier studies x remains unknown, Previous studies have only looked at x.
Check if you have included these sentences in your essay.

AcaWriter didn't identify any Results/Findings moves in your conclusion. Here you state what you found and/or your answer to the essay question.
My evidence confirms that..., The analysis shows... My review found... Significant improvements in x have been developed., The major innovation of x is its ability to identify/detect y.
Check if you have included these sentences in your conclusion.

message.txt: Wondering why AcaWriter is highlighting your sentences as specific moves? The table below shows how the moves you make are identified by AcaWriter’s tags.

MoveAcaWriter tagsSentence examples
Background / ContextEmphasisE Management practices (such as culture, empowerment, communication and innovation) are significant to the successful performance of organisations.
TrendT A focus on organisational [culture, empowerment, communication, innovation] is growing worldwide.
BackgroundB Management theories indicate that organisational performance is related to the organisation’s internal [culture, empowerment, communication, innovation] practices.
Purpose of the Paper / Present ResearchSummaryS The aim of this paper is to critically evaluate the impacts of management practices (such as culture, empowerment, communication and innovation) on organisational performance.

S I present recent examples of organisational success and failure.
Research Problem / Issues / Critiques / Gap in the literatureContrastC This approach fails to address the issue of empowerment of women in sporting organisations.
QuestionQ However, little research has been conducted on disruption and its impact on performance in the banking industry.
Results / Findings SummaryS The examples also show that the lack of communication with external stakeholders was detrimental to organisational success.
NoveltyN My findings have been innovative to demonstrate that an organisation which focusses on a culture of compassion, rather than ‘every man for himself’ is the key to success.
